SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

xdi2.core
Interface ContextNode

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<ContextNode>, Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractContextNode, BasicContextNode, KeyValueContextNode, MemoryContextNode
public interface ContextNode
extends Serializable, Comparable<ContextNode>

This interface represents a whole XDI graph. XDI graphs consist of subjects and statements between them. Operations on the graph include creating new statements and subjects, finding and manipulating them.

Author:
markus

isLeafContextNode

boolean isLeafContextNode()
Checks if this context node is a leaf context node.

Returns:
True, if this context node is a leaf context node.

delete

void delete()
Deletes this context node.

clear

void clear()
Clears the context node. This is equivalent to calling deleteContextNodes(), deleteRelations() and deleteLiterals().

isEmpty

boolean isEmpty()
Checks if the context node is empty. This is equivalent to calling ! ( containsContextNodes() || containsRelations() || containsLiterals() ).

getArcXri

XRI3SubSegment getArcXri()
Every context node has an associated arc XRI. This returns null for the root context node.

Returns:
The arc XRI associated with this context node.

getXri

XRI3Segment getXri()
Gets the XRI of this context node. This returns () for the root context node.

Returns:
The XRI of this context node.
